0.name: Monochromatic
0.description: Monochromatic colors use one color with various tints, tones, and shades for the painting. The color scheme is simple but powerful.

1.name: Complementary
1.description: Complementary colors lie directly across the color wheel from each other and create a powerful duo.

2.name: Analogous
2.description: Analogous color uses colors that are next to each other on the color wheel. Usually match well and create serene designs.

3.name: Triadic
3.description: Triadic colors use three evenly spaced colors on the color wheel. It provides strong visual contrast with harmony.

4.name: Tetradic
4.description: Tetradic uses four colors in two complementary pairs. It offers rich color diversity and balance.
